skill.name: changelog-generator
skill.description: Automatically creates user-facing changelogs from git commits by analyzing commit history, categorizing changes, and transforming technical commits into clear, customer-friendly release notes. Turns hours of manual changelog writing into minutes of automated generation.

skill.author: ComposioHQ

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-only skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation describing how to use natural language to generate changelogs with Claude. No scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities present.

content.user_title: Generate user-friendly changelogs from git commits
content.value_statement: Writing changelogs manually takes hours of work to translate technical commits into customer-friendly language. This skill automatically analyzes git history, categorizes changes, and creates polished release notes that users can understand.
actual_capabilities: Scans git commit history from specific time periods or versions
Categorizes commits into features, improvements, bug fixes, and breaking changes
Translates technical commit messages into customer-friendly language
Creates professionally formatted markdown changelog entries
Filters out internal commits like refactoring and tests
Follows changelog best practices and brand voice guidelines
limitations: Does not directly access git repositories - requires user to provide commit information
Cannot create git tags or manage versions automatically
Output quality depends on clarity of original commit messages
Cannot push changes directly to remote repositories

use_cases.title: Create release communications
use_cases.description: Generate customer-facing release notes for new versions, weekly updates, or feature announcements

use_cases.title: Maintain public changelogs
use_cases.description: Create and update CHANGELOG.md files that help users understand what changed in each release

use_cases.title: Write documentation faster
use_cases.description: Automatically transform commit history into documentation without manual rewriting

prompt_templates.title: Basic changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog from commits since last release

prompt_templates.title: Version-based changelog
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate changelog for a specific version

prompt_templates.title: Custom style changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog for commits since v2.4.0, using my changelog guidelines from CHANGELOG_STYLE.md

best_practices: Run the skill from your git repository root for accurate commit analysis
Provide custom style guidelines via CHANGELOG_STYLE.md for consistent branding
Review and edit the generated changelog before publishing to customers
anti_patterns: Expecting perfect output without reviewing commit message quality
Using the skill without specifying date ranges for large repositories
Skipping the edit step and publishing changelogs directly without human review

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool provides slightly different formatting capabilities.

faq.question: How far back can the skill analyze commit history?
faq.answer: The skill can analyze any commit range your git repository contains. Very large histories may take longer to process.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, you can use the skill within CI/CD scripts by providing commit ranges or tag comparisons as input.

faq.question: Is my git data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. The skill processes git information locally through your AI tool. No repository data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why are some commits missing from the output?
faq.answer: The skill filters internal commits like refactoring, test updates, and maintenance changes to focus on user-facing changes.

faq.question: How does this compare to conventional changelog tools?
faq.answer: Unlike automated tools that just list commits, this skill translates technical language into customer-friendly descriptions.
